This is I200402122000. The problem persisted until I disabled YourKit and did
not reappear after enabling YK again.

I now disabled YK and switched from running from java.exe to eclipse.exe and the
exception reapeared.

I have only the resource perspective, the navigator view and no editor open.

The fourth time I started up I found the following, not sure if this is related:

Moving to Equinox for comment re: PluginConvertor.
Adding Darin to CC re: NPE in comment #2.

The error on PluginConverterImpl is really surprising since it occurs while 
writing the last part of a file in which things have already been written and 
there is no close instruction.

Basically the code is 
- open file
- writeOneStuff
- writeAnother
- generateRequiredBundle
- close

The problem is caused by the absence of synchronization on the plugin 
converter. 

A simple solution consists in synchronizing the convert methods.
Otherwise, instead of having a singleton we could have a servicefactory.
*** Bug 52165 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed as suggested by Pascal (synchronization at entry points). 
Released to HEAD.
